meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a duopoly.
meanings.sent1: The duopolistic nature of the market led to limited choices for consumers.
meanings.sent2: The duopolistic companies dominated the industry, setting prices and controlling supply.
meanings.sent3: It was a duopolistic dance-off between the two best performers in town.
meanings.sent4: The duopolistic rivalry between the two pizza chains heated up as they competed for customers.
meanings.sent5: The duopolistic relationship between the two superheroes kept the city safe from harm.

meanings.definition: Involving or controlled by two companies or organizations.
meanings.sent1: The duopolistic agreement between the two tech giants limited competition in the market.
meanings.sent2: The duopolistic partnership between the two airlines allowed them to dominate the routes.
meanings.sent3: The duopolistic battle for the top spot in the industry was fierce and intense.
meanings.sent4: The duopolistic control of the market by the two companies squeezed out smaller businesses.
meanings.sent5: The duopolistic collaboration between the two artists produced groundbreaking work that amazed the art world.
